metadata.title: Technology Dictionary
metadata.description: A dictionary of technology and computing terms
metadata.author: Dictionary Project Team

entries.definition: A step-by-step procedure or formula for solving a problem, especially by a computer. Algorithms are used for calculation, data processing, and automated reasoning.
Application Programming Interface - a set of routines, protocols, and tools for building software applications. APIs specify how software components should interact.
A digital ledger of transactions that is duplicated and distributed across a network of computer systems. It records information in a way that makes it difficult or impossible to change or hack.
The delivery of computing services—including servers, storage, databases, networking, software, analytics, and intelligence—over the Internet ('the cloud').
An organized collection of structured information or data, typically stored electronically in a computer system and controlled by a database management system (DBMS).
The process of converting information or data into a code to prevent unauthorized access. Encryption uses algorithms to scramble data, which can only be unscrambled with a decryption key.

A network security system that monitors and controls incoming and outgoing network traffic based on predetermined security rules. It establishes a barrier between a trusted network and untrusted networks.
Graphical User Interface - a visual way of interacting with a computer using items such as windows, icons, and menus, used by most modern operating systems.
The physical components of a computer system, including the case, central processing unit (CPU), monitor, keyboard, and more.
The interconnection via the Internet of computing devices embedded in everyday objects, enabling them to send and receive data.
JavaScript Object Notation - a lightweight data interchange format that is easy for humans to read and write and easy for machines to parse and generate.
The core component of an operating system that manages operations of the computer and hardware. It basically manages operations of memory and CPU time.
The delay before a transfer of data begins following an instruction for its transfer. In networking, it refers to the time it takes for a data packet to travel from source to destination.

An integrated circuit that contains all the functions of a central processing unit (CPU) of a computer. It's a multipurpose, programmable device that accepts digital data as input, processes it according to instructions stored in its memory, and provides results as output.
A collection of computers, servers, mainframes, network devices, peripherals, or other devices connected to one another to allow the sharing of data.
Software that manages computer hardware and software resources and provides common services for computer programs. The operating system is a component of the system software in a computer system.

A set of rules or procedures for transmitting data between electronic devices, such as computers. In networking, protocols govern the format, timing, sequencing, and error control in data communication.

A type of computation that harnesses the collective properties of quantum states, such as superposition and entanglement, to perform calculations. It uses quantum bits or qubits instead of classical bits.
A networking device that forwards data packets between computer networks. Routers perform the traffic directing functions on the Internet and other packet-switched networks.
The programs and other operating information used by a computer. Software is a set of instructions or data that tells a computer how to work.
A technique in programming that enables multiple threads of execution to run concurrently within a program. This allows for parallel execution of multiple tasks.

User Datagram Protocol - a connectionless protocol that operates on top of the Internet Protocol (IP). It provides a way to send messages (datagrams) without establishing a connection or ensuring reliable delivery.
A simulated experience that can be similar to or completely different from the real world. Applications of virtual reality include entertainment (particularly video games) and education.
A software application for accessing and viewing websites on the internet. Common web browsers include Chrome, Firefox, Safari, and Edge.
Extensible Markup Language - a markup language that defines a set of rules for encoding documents in a format that is both human-readable and machine-readable.
YAML Ain't Markup Language - a human-readable data serialization standard that can be used in conjunction with programming languages. It's commonly used for configuration files.
A software vulnerability that is exploited before a vendor becomes aware of it. Because the developer has had zero days to address and patch the vulnerability, it poses a significant security risk.
A software development methodology characterized by iterative development, where requirements and solutions evolve through collaboration between cross-functional teams.
Extremely large data sets that may be analyzed computationally to reveal patterns, trends, and associations, especially relating to human behavior and interactions.

A hardware or software component that stores data so that future requests for that data can be served faster. The data stored in a cache might be the result of an earlier computation or a copy of data stored elsewhere.
